chunk: Hey guys, Zach Gully here, your golf fitness professional. I'm going to help you guys with five exercises you can do with the golf cart to warm up before

we're going to reach the left hand under as far as you can. And then we're going to rotate to your left with that left arm as far as possible.
Now I want you to run through all of these for 15 or 20 times. You guys are just moving through and trying to feel
stretch underneath the right shoulder down through the back. So that's going to be your first one. Second one, we're going to stay holding on to this cart. Now, you can either grab up in the
handle here or on this side bar. And this one, we're just going to try to get some soft rotations through the low
back, the hip, the ankle, and it's just a gentle swing of your leg. Now, your left foot. Let's work hard not
to let the left ankle roll out like this where you're keeping ball to foot planted trying to work on supenating the
bones in the feet. Again, 15 or 20 times. And you guys will do that on the other leg as well.
Another one I like to do is to hold on to something again, maybe about midbody height. And here is
just going to be some turns where you're working on rotating your hips. We're using this to keep your upper body still so we can create a little bit more
separation down in the lower half. And you're trying not to let the shoulders move.
This is another 15 to 20 times. This one is for the back side of the shoulder. You're going to stand as if
you're hitting a golf shot away from your golf cart. We're going to take the left arm. You're going to reach across your body. Grab a hold of the pole.
Right hand. We're going to push with the right, pull with the left. Little turns
with the hips to the left. This one should be a massive stretch through the low back, maybe on the back side of the
left shoulder. And this one should again help us to create a little bit better separation. Let's do 15 to 20 on that one as well.
And then your last one, you guys are going to stand next to the cart. We're going to stretch our chest here. You're going to take your left
